biography.summary: Elected in 2012, Ted Cruz serves as the senior U.S. Senator from Texas. Known for his work on constitutional law and conservative policy, he sits on several key committees.
biography.early_life: Born in Calgary, Alberta, Cruz attended Princeton and Harvard Law before serving as Solicitor General of Texas.
biography.career: Before joining the Senate, Cruz argued cases before the Supreme Court and worked in the Bush administration.

policy_positions.stance: Opposes the Affordable Care Act; advocates for market-driven healthcare reform.
Supports domestic oil and gas production; opposed federal restrictions on drilling.
Advocates for free speech online and reducing federal oversight of social platforms.
